name.text: Determining the surface area of the closed cuboid from its net.

questiontext.text:
Calculate the surface area of the box given below from its net,

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-20, 250, 250, -20], axis: false, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false }); // Vertex coordinates var A = board.create('point', [60, 60], {visible:false}); var B = board.create('point', [150, 60], {visible:false}); var C = board.create('point', [150, 120], {visible:false}); var D = board.create('point', [60, 120], {visible:false}); var E = board.create('point', [105, 15], {visible:false}); var F = board.create('point', [195, 15], {visible:false}); var G = board.create('point', [195, 75], {visible:false}); var H = board.create('point', [105, 75], {visible:false}); // Faces (same layout and color as SVG) var front = board.create('polygon', [A, B, C, D], { fillColor: 'blue', fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, vertices: {visible: false} }); var back = board.create('polygon', [E, F, G, H], { fillColor: 'blue', fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, vertices: {visible: false} }); var topFace = board.create('polygon', [A, B, F, E], { fillColor: 'orange', fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, vertices: {visible: false} }); var bottomFace = board.create('polygon', [D, C, G, H], { fillColor: 'orange', fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, vertices: {visible: false} }); var rightFace = board.create('polygon', [B, C, G, F], { fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, vertices: {visible: false} }); var leftFace = board.create('polygon', [A, D, H, E], { fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, vertices: {visible: false} }); // Midpoint markers var midDC = board.create('point', [105, 120], {visible:false, size:2, fillColor:'black'}); var midCG = board.create('point', [172.5, 97.5], {visible:false, size:2, fillColor:'black'}); var midGF = board.create('point', [195, 45], {visible:false, size:2, fillColor:'black'}); // Dimension labels board.create('text', [110, 130, '{#length#}cm'], {fontSize:12}); board.create('text', [177, 107, '{#width#}cm'], {fontSize:12}); board.create('text', [200, 55, '{#height#}cm'], {fontSize:12}); [[/jsxgraph]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

(a).The figure below shows the net of the box

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-40, 550, 700, -60], keepAspectRatio: false, axis: false, showCopyright: false }); var s = 120; // cell size var x0 = 180; // left column x var yTop = 480; // row1 y (largest y is top visually) var col = function(c){ return x0 + (c-1)*s; }; var row = function(r){ return yTop - (r-1)*s; }; // helper to draw a face and optional edge labels function drawFace(id, c, r, color, labels) { var x = col(c), y = row(r); var P1 = board.create('point', [x, y], {visible:false}); var P2 = board.create('point', [x + s, y], {visible:false}); var P3 = board.create('point', [x + s, y - s], {visible:false}); var P4 = board.create('point', [x, y - s], {visible:false}); board.create('polygon', [P1, P2, P3, P4], { fillColor: color, fillOpacity: 0.9, borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1.5}, vertices: {visible: false} }); // Center label (face letter) board.create('text', [x + s/2 - 6, y - s/2 + 6, id], {fontSize: 16, color: 'black'}); // Edge dimension labels if (labels) { if (labels.top) board.create('text', [x + s/2, y + 10, labels.top], {fontSize: 11, color: 'black'}); if (labels.bottom) board.create('text', [x + s/2, y - s - 15, labels.bottom], {fontSize: 11, color: 'black'}); if (labels.left) board.create('text', [x - 35, y - s/2 + 6, labels.left], {fontSize: 11, color: 'black'}); if (labels.right) board.create('text', [x + s + 20, y - s/2 + 6, labels.right], {fontSize: 11, color: 'black'}); } } // Layout matches your HTML: // A(3,1), B(3,2), C(3,3), D(3,4), E(2,3), F(4,3) drawFace('A', 3, 1, 'orange', { top: '{#length#} cm', left: '{#width#} cm', right: '{#width#} cm' }); drawFace('B', 3, 2, 'blue', { bottom: '{#length#} cm', left: '{#height#} cm', right: '{#height#} cm' }); drawFace('C', 3, 3, 'orange', { // no labels for this face }); drawFace('D', 3, 4, 'blue', { bottom: '{#length#} cm', right: '{#height#} cm' }); drawFace('E', 2, 3, 'cyan', { bottom: '{#height#} cm', left: '{#width#} cm' }); drawFace('F', 4, 3, 'cyan', { bottom: '{#height#} cm', right: '{#width#} cm' }); // Optional: light grid lines to outline folds for (var c = 1; c <= 5; c++) { for (var r = 1; r <= 5; r++) { var x = col(c), y = row(r); var p1 = board.create('point', [x, y], {visible: false}); var p2 = board.create('point', [x + s, y], {visible: false}); var p3 = board.create('point', [x + s, y - s], {visible: false}); var p4 = board.create('point', [x, y - s], {visible: false}); board.create('polygon', [p1, p2, p3, p4], { borders: {strokeColor: '#ccc', strokeWidth: 0.5}, fillOpacity: 0, vertices: {visible: false} }); } } [[/jsxgraph]]

(b).Surface area of the box

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of a rectangle}&=length \times width\\\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of rectangle A}&={@length@} cm\times{@width@} cm\\&={@area_of_rectangleA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of rectangle B}&={@length@} cm\times{@height@} cm\\&={@area_of_rectangleB@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of rectangle C}&={@length@} cm\times{@width@} cm\\&={@area_of_rectangleC@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of rectangle D}&={@length@} cm\times{@height@} cm\\&={@area_of_rectangleD@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of rectangle E}&={@width@} cm\times{@height@} cm\\&={@area_of_rectangleE@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of rectangle F}&={@width@} cm\times{@height@} cm\\&={@area_of_rectangleF@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Surface area}&={@area_of_rectangleA@} cm^2+{@area_of_rectangleB@} cm^2+{@area_of_rectangleC@} cm^2+{@area_of_rectangleD@} cm^2+{@area_of_rectangleE@} cm^2+{@area_of_rectangleF@} cm^2\\&={@ta@} cm^2\end{align}\)

truefeedback.text: It looks like you might have assumed that all the faces of the cuboid are the same. Remember, a cuboid has six faces, but the faces are typically rectangles, not squares. Each pair of opposite faces has the same dimensions, but the dimensions for different pairs can be different from each other. Make sure to identify the length, width, and height properly and use the correct side lengths for each face.
